name: D. Balancing
statement:
Ecrade has an integer array a_1, a_2,
ldots, a_n. It’s guaranteed that for each 1
le i < n, a_i
neq a_{i+1}.Ecrade can perform several operations on the array to make
it strictly increasing.In each operation, he can choose two integers l
and r (1
le l
le r
le n) and replace a_l, a_{l+1},
ldots, a_r with any r-l+1 integers a’_l, a’_{l+1},
ldots, a’_r satisfying the following constraint: For each l
le i < r, the comparison between a’_i and a’_{i+1} is the same as that
between a_i and a_{i+1}, i.e., if a_i < a_{i + 1}, then a’_i < a’_{i +
1}; otherwise, if a_i > a_{i + 1}, then a’_i > a’_{i + 1}; otherwise, if
a_i = a_{i + 1}, then a’_i = a’_{i + 1}. Ecrade wants to know the
minimum number of operations to make the array strictly increasing.
However, it seems a little difficult, so please help him!
